intro: Ptilotus drummondii var. elongatus, commonly known as the long-stemmed spinifex, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy soils. Its leaves are usually reduced to small scales, and the flowers are often pink or red in color. This variety is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
